meanings.definition: Arranged in a loose, branching cluster.
meanings.sent1: The paniculate flowers spread out in a wide, open pattern.
meanings.sent2: The tree had paniculate leaves that created a beautiful, airy canopy.
meanings.sent3: The paniculate arrangement of snacks on the table made it easy for everyone to grab a treat.
meanings.sent4: Her paniculate thoughts branched out in all directions, making it hard to focus on just one idea.
meanings.sent5: The paniculate design of the fireworks display lit up the night sky in a mesmerizing way.

meanings.sent1: The paniculate clusters of flowers on the bush attracted many bees.
meanings.sent2: The garden was filled with paniculate blooms of various colors.
meanings.sent3: The paniculate flower arrangement at the event looked like a tiny floral fireworks display.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was a paniculate cascade of curls that framed her face beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The paniculate pattern of vines climbing up the wall created a natural work of art.
